shortdesc.ph: Sets the format of the ear monitoring audio data.
Sets the format of the ear monitoring audio data.

p.codeblock: virtual int setEarMonitoringAudioFrameParameters(int sampleRate, int channel, RAW_AUDIO_FRAME_OP_MODE_TYPE mode, int samplesPerCall) = 0;
public abstract int setEarMonitoringAudioFrameParameters(int sampleRate, int channel, int mode, int samplesPerCall);

section.p: This method sets the format of the audio data reported in the callback.
This method sets the format of the ear monitoring audio data reported in the callback.

ul.li: Before calling this method, you must call and set includeAudioFilters to EAR_MONITORING_FILTER_BUILT_IN_AUDIO_FILTERS or EAR_MONITORING_FILTER_NOISE_SUPPRESSION.

The SDK calculates the sampling interval based on samplesPerCall, sampleRate, and channel. Sampling interval (in seconds) = samplesPerCall / (sampleRate × channel). Make sure the interval is ≥ 0.01 seconds. The SDK triggers the callback based on this interval.
Before calling this method, you must call enableInEarMonitoring and set includeAudioFilters to EAR_MONITORING_FILTER_BUILT_IN_AUDIO_FILTERS or EAR_MONITORING_FILTER_NOISE_SUPPRESSION.

The SDK calculates the sampling interval based on the samplesPerCall, sampleRate, and channel parameters. Sampling interval (seconds) = samplesPerCall / (sampleRate × channel). Ensure the sampling interval is ≥ 0.01 seconds. The SDK triggers the callback based on the sampling interval.

plentry.pd: The sampling rate reported in the callback. Can be set to 8000, 16000, 32000, 44100, or 48000 Hz.

The number of audio channels reported in the callback.
1: Mono.
2: Stereo.
The usage mode of the audio frame. See .
The number of samples reported in each callback, e.g., 1024 for media streaming.
The sampling rate reported in the callback. Can be set to 8000, 16000, 32000, 44100, or 48000 Hz.

The number of audio channels reported in the callback:
1: Mono.
2: Stereo.

Usage mode of the audio frame:
RAW_AUDIO_FRAME_OP_MODE_READ_ONLY (0): (Default) Read-only mode. For example, the user retrieves data via the Agora SDK and pushes RTMP or RTMPS streams.
RAW_AUDIO_FRAME_OP_MODE_READ_WRITE (2): Read-write mode. The user reads data from , modifies it, and plays it back. For example, the user has a custom audio effects module and performs voice preprocessing such as voice changing.
The number of samples per call reported in the callback, e.g., 1024 for media streaming.
